However, when you're talking about a specific product in the product-specific channel, such claims need specific - at the very least, what adjustments were done and when? Author: Bowtiesarecool
Title: ⚡BQT - SOCIAL P2P CRYPTO EXCHANGE AND HEDGE TRADING PLATFORM ⚡
Body: Here's a few reasons why BQT is the groundbreaking DEX we've all been waiting for:  "BQT invented new decentralized approach to hedge crypto assets against other traders.  Just like selling covered option calls/puts on stock market – BQT allows traders to acquire more crypto for short term (up to 30 days) without selling their own crypto.  BQT works as combination of Option-Margin-Auction in each trade.  Trader Peers can dictate/negotiate the conditions of each trade and post it for an “auction” against other peer traders to compete against the multiple offers.  This makes an honest market dealings for traders and fixes significant fees for the company revenue model.  So if I have 1BTC I can place 20% premium hedge offer on exchange (1.2 BTC) to ask community to give me 1BTC worth of ETH for 30 days.  I will be receiving competing offers lowering my premium “say to 10%” and upon accepting it would place 1.1BTC into escrow (which is stored by BQT in cold wallet during the escrow period) and immediately receive 1BTC worth of ETH from peer trader.  For providing the premium I now have an option (any time during the hedge period) to either return ETH (with premium) or give up the escrow – so I can play with 2 crypto assets and if say ETH goes up 40% (as we saw recently) I would simply give up the escrow with premium and keep my gains on ETH.  This is a very unique concept!!  https://vimeo.com/280874044  - shows it in more details.  Let me highlights important benefits:   1. All trader wallets are decentralized and controlled by peer traders 2. Escrow is guaranteed by the company and is securely stored. 3. BQTX tokens are utilized for escrow fees (with 50% discount) 4. Company is to allocate 30% of escrow fees revenues to buy back BQTX from or traders (and other exchanges) every quarter and burn them (therefore reducing BQTX inventory which impacts the value of a token).  This is much better alternative vs security dividend paying tokens. 5. Company also would share 20% of escrow fees / revenues quarterly with 10% most active traders following our proprietary algorithm.  This would benefit utilization of the platform.  In addition, we are to announce affiliate program to invite traders and benefit affiliate on revenue share from future trades generated by new users.      This process creates a very transparent system for traders to leverage their crypto holdings and increase their portfolio without risks of system manipulation and in secure manner."

Author: Bowtiesarecool
Title: ⚡BQT - SOCIAL P2P CRYPTO EXCHANGE AND HEDGE TRADING PLATFORM ⚡
Body: Eddie has put pen to paper to provide us with yet another insight into the future of crypto adoption.  "I’m glad 2018 happened.  Don’t get me wrong. I took as much of a bath short-term as anyone who holds cryptocurrency. But you can’t even call it a paper loss because the whole attraction is the lack of paper. Call it a pixel loss.  But we purged all the fear out of the system. It was at the price of giving back all of 2017 but, in the long run, it was worth it. Everyone who was afraid of missing out either chucked out their entire portfolios or let them lay fallow. There is no more fear of missing out. There’s just the fact of missing out"  Read all about it here

Author: Bowtiesarecool
Title: ⚡BQT - SOCIAL P2P CRYPTO EXCHANGE AND HEDGE TRADING PLATFORM ⚡
Body: BQTX has released another article critically examining the current strategies employed by DEXes and how to get the best out of any exchange dealing with decentralized asset ownership.  "One way to approach decentralization along all these lines at the architectural level is to build a currency-neutral platform. This is distinct from currency-specific platforms that center around one particular coin, such as VCTrade for ripple or IDEX for ether. Not that there’s anything wrong with that, as long as you hold those coins. Although they’re widely accepted cryptocurrencies in their own rights (“widely accepted” being a relative term), they function as utility tokens on those exchanges. As a result, you have to maintain a pool of coins for which you might not otherwise have a purpose. It’s kind of back-door intermediation — and dexes ought to, in my opinion at least, be doing all they can to reduce middlemen whether they use the front door, back door, side door or chimney"  Read all about it here

Author: jhenfelipe
Title: ⚡BQT - SOCIAL P2P CRYPTO EXCHANGE AND HEDGE TRADING PLATFORM ⚡
Body: Remember that I posted pictures of BQT CEO and COO with John McAfee here? Edward (the CEO) has shared his feelings and more photos of them during the Blockchain Cruise with some interesting descriptions. It's a bit late, but I thought the pics and info are still worth to share.     Quote from: https://t.me/BQTCommunity/17864 Met my inspiration true legend John Mcafee! Believe it or not he was my first employer 25 years ago.  I was Sr. IT developer for McAfee working out of Dallas TX office then Network Associates in UK.  John is the businessman with open mind who will tell you things exactly the way they are without any filter.  Great inspiration for many and true Blockchain Enthusiast!  Owe this guy forever!!   Quote from: https://t.me/BQTCommunity/17868 Also great Bobby Lee - BTCC Founder and Bitcoin Foundation Chairman...   Quote from: https://t.me/BQTCommunity/17870 Jorg Molt... Bitcoin co founder and Chairman of Bitcoin Education... what a passion this guy has to help community to educate on crypto and its benefits.  A humble guy who wants to see blockchain projects utilized and helps many people to bring awareness...   Quote from: https://t.me/BQTCommunity/17872 And this is highlight of my trip was going to SanRemo with my amico / my brother / true ICO Driver Luca Cota - #1 performance ICObench expert - co founder of ETHlend! Every ICO he touches goes to the moon!! He is doing due diligence on BQT now. I am keeping my fingers (and toes) crossed lol... Great times!     PS. Since there are more images here than the previous post, I resized them to 50%. If you want to see the Pics in original sizes, just check it here in imgur post or in Telegram links along the quotes above. PPS. Just like before, please don't include the images in your quote when you reply to this. Thank you!   BQT CEO Edward is really busy He is now on the Brazil FinTech Roadshow (CTM: 17-19 September), not sure though if who is he with (maybe COO Konstntinos and other team members). I'm sure @Zapo will update us about it soon    Quote from: HMember on September 17, 2018, 08:44:52 AM Whether active distribution of a token and an exit to third-party exchanges is planned in the future? Or the auction will be only on bqt-exchange? I think if the second option, then growth of a token is doomed to a failure. Well, let's not base the success or failure of a token on Exchange listings. If BQT platform will have a great volume in the future, more people would possibly support the token.  Anyway, they have plans of listing it to other exchanges, check these admins' previous replies as reference:  Quote from: https://t.me/BQTCommunity/18058 Hello. The token will be listed after the end of the ICO. Quote from: https://t.me/BQTCommunity/18138 We aren't currently listed on any exchanges, that comes after the ICO concludes Quote from: https://t.me/BQTCommunity/18139 We will be announcing exchange listings next month, but the big exchange news is that we will be listed on OUR OWN exchange once we go live in 2019 The whitelisting for our closed Beta will begin next week so make sure to sign up!

Author: xtraelv
Title: ⚡BQT - SOCIAL P2P CRYPTO EXCHANGE AND HEDGE TRADING PLATFORM ⚡
Body: Personally I don't know whether an exchange would have to be so uniquely different from others in the market. I think differences will be subtle and perhaps not so hugely different from others. It is a massive growing market and I think new entrants need to have some decent capital funding to enter the market with some success. Existing exchanges have the advantage of having been able to build on their existing code as they earned. There will be room for new companies. For comparison - How uniquely different are forex companies ? I think their success usually is based on confidence, trust, accessibility, marketing and reliability of giving the same day to day services.  Binance started out with an ICO and grew very quickly into a market leader. I don't think anyone expected quite such a rapid growth.  But as the crypto world evolves - Exchanges need to: Be secure Have good code Easy to use platform Ability to operate BOTs & auto trades Fast trade engine Have good hot wallet and cold wallet practices. Have good governance Have a good legal structure Be located in a good jurisdiction suitable for crypto. Be located in a country with a good legal system that can handle legal disputes Be located in a country where authorities provide some oversight to protect investors (without killing the innovation).  As they say: "the proof will be in the pudding".  Edward Mandel (Eddie) is providing me with lots of updates and photos since I posted questions about this ICO - which has been very productive in establishing that it is an ICO being held by real business people with a proven track record.

Author: bellicose
Title: ⚡BQT - SOCIAL P2P CRYPTO EXCHANGE AND HEDGE TRADING PLATFORM ⚡

Author: xtraelv
Title: ⚡BQT - SOCIAL P2P CRYPTO EXCHANGE AND HEDGE TRADING PLATFORM ⚡
Body: I don't understand your question.  I think a lot of the success of an ICO depends on whether they can deliver on their promises. No unrealistic promises were made and action is better than words. From a investment perspective I have no idea how this project will do. The main thing I was concerned about is whether the project was real. I am satisfied that it is a real project with real people. ROI always has a much better prospect when the investment is in a real product / business.  With an unregulated new investment the outcome is primarily dependent on the caliber of people that run the business. Market predictions - until they happen - are speculation.

Author: Bowtiesarecool
Title: ⚡BQT - SOCIAL P2P CRYPTO EXCHANGE AND HEDGE TRADING PLATFORM ⚡
Body: Here's a direct response from Ed, on the issue https://t.me/BQTCommunity/15832  ...I can't agree more that US is unfairly restricting US citizens (and I'm one of them) in order to protect the banking system.  I as you can imagine travel quite a bit and see how much wider crypto is utilized around the world... just recently in Barcelona I walked into Audi dealership and could buy a 100k$ car with bitcoin.  That's besides "we accept bitcoins" signs over 50% of small shops I randomly visited.  But it is what it is... and laws are very strict and require multi state licenses.  As P2P exchange we could just as Localbitcoin take a position of entering US market right away and point all regulatory risks to our users. We decided to launch in EMEA and APAC market first while continuing to lobby for legislatures (with other players) and acquire proper state licenses in US.  I can promise you however that we are not putting it into long basket.  Our goal is to beat expectations of our road map projections as US market is most important initiative for the company.  But we will enter it after all beta related "bugs" and unexpected issues are mostly out of the way.  I very much on board and always fighting to advocate the importance of Blockchain and crypto  in effort to tremendously advance progress of technology innovations.  I speak about it on conferences and very vocal on thr subject regulators.  US is behind but lots of $$ been put into crypto projects by prominent VCs and PE firms... it is inevitable that rapid utilization of crypto technologies on Blockchain networks would be hitting US soon. Especially as ALL major banks and financial institutions spending billions of dollars to integrate Blockchain and crypto into their operations.  I personally believe that is the precise reason of stalling thing in US... letting banks to catch up. Cheers to all!

Author: jhenfelipe

Author: wwzsocki
Title: ⚡BQT - SOCIAL P2P CRYPTO EXCHANGE AND HEDGE TRADING PLATFORM ⚡
Body: That was mission impossible to find this ANN thread. There is no link to find on the web page or even in the bounty thread. I haven't found on social media also. I think this is a big mistake and that is why this thread looks like this. Almost dead only with few spammy answers.  I think this should be adjusted and links added all over social media and ICO page. Good visibility is the key. BTT forum is so crowded that an Announcement thread is visible on the first page of the subforum only for few minutes or even seconds. Real people and discussion are needed to attract investors. I am an investor and when I evaluate an ICO I always look for ann thread full of people and valuable discussion. In such a thread I search for information and answers to my questions.  Not everybody is using Telegram.

Author: jhenfelipe
Title: ⚡BQT - SOCIAL P2P CRYPTO EXCHANGE AND HEDGE TRADING PLATFORM ⚡
Body: Pre-ICO starts on August 18, but you can already apply for whitelisting.   What price? Minimum & maximum purchase? 1 ETH = 800 BQTX . It was noted that the minimum purchase is 200 BQTX   Is there any special bonus for vip investors? VIP investors? Not sure about that. You can use their Bonus Calculator to check how many bonus tokens you'll get for purchasing xx amount. Complete list of bonuses are as follows:     Do I need KYC to invest into your project? Yes. You need to go through a KYC/AML process to join the ICO.   All information I gave can be seen in the website and whitepaper. If you need more, you can go through those or join the Telegram group.

Author: KonstantinosM
Title: ⚡BQT - SOCIAL P2P CRYPTO EXCHANGE AND HEDGE TRADING PLATFORM ⚡
Body: Why are people from the United States excluded?  As Andreas Antonopoulos has stated before. The lack of KYC/AML is a feature, not a bug. (Talking about bitcoin).  Will you be friendly to US customers in the future? Are you going to look for legal solutions?  It's not the fault of people in the United States that they live under such a strict and corrupt government and it would be a win-win for any project to receive investment from one of the worlds biggest country (and possibly richest).

Author: LaScuderia
Title: ⚡BQT - SOCIAL P2P CRYPTO EXCHANGE AND HEDGE TRADING PLATFORM ⚡
Body: The reason is very simple if they violate some obligations when selling, then the US court can demand the arrest of the creators. The risk of this in an area that is not being re-designed is very, very large. In order not to risk it is easiest to exclude from sale.
